metadata.Title: CVE-2021-45083 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description: An issue was discovered in Cobbler before 3.3.1. Files in /etc/cobbler are world readable. Two of those files contain some sensitive information that can be exposed to a local user who has non-privileged access to the server. The users.digest file contains the sha2-512 digest of users in a Cobbler local installation. In the case of an easy-to-guess password, it's trivial to obtain the plaintext string. The settings.yaml file contains secrets such as the hashed default password.

criterions.comment: cobbler: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
